meanings.definition: The amount that a vat can hold.
meanings.sent1: The farmer poured vatfuls of water into the large container.
meanings.sent2: The winery needed many vatfuls of grapes to make their wine.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally spilled vatfuls of flour while baking a cake.
meanings.sent4: The lake seemed to swallow up vatfuls of rainwater during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The factory produced vatfuls of liquid soap every day.

meanings.sent1: The warehouse stored many vatfuls of oil for distribution.
meanings.sent2: The market sold various vatfuls of spices and seasonings.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game, pretending to measure vatfuls of imaginary treasures.
meanings.sent4: The garden was filled with flowers, blooming in colorful vatfuls.
meanings.sent5: The store received multiple vatfuls of fresh fruits and vegetables for sale.
